reviewTitle: "A compact powerhouse with a near-perfect balance of premium sound and portability!"
reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
        
    
    








  
  
    ¬†Purchased From: Amazon.inDate of Purchase: 11th November 2024Price: ‚Çπ1,599"A compact powerhouse with a near-perfect balance of premium sound and portability!"After an exhaustive search, trying over 30-50 speakers, I finally landed on the Tribit StormBox Mini 12W, and it has exceeded most of my expectations. Having gone through several speakers that fell short of delivering the right mix of bass, vocals, and durability, this one strikes a remarkable balance. Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown of my experience:---Previous DisappointmentsTribit StormBox (Original): Despite its XBass feature, it didn‚Äôt deliver the deep, satisfying bass I was looking for.Tribit Sound Go (2024 Edition): Excellent for vocals, but bass lovers like me might feel let down.Boat Stone 1800: Overemphasized bass that drowned out vocals and lacked refinement. Build quality and sound effects felt subpar.These experiences made me cautious but also determined to find a speaker that could deliver both bass and clarity, and the Tribit StormBox Mini did not disappoint!---Highlights of the Tribit StormBox Mini1. Sound QualityVocals and Clarity: This speaker excels at delivering crystal-clear vocals even at maximum volume. Highs and lows are well-balanced, making it ideal for a variety of genres.Bass: While it has decent bass with the XBass feature, it‚Äôs worth noting that at maximum volume, the speaker automatically lowers its output slightly to accommodate bass-heavy tracks. This adjustment ensures clarity but might not satisfy those looking for overpowering, punchy bass.360¬∞ Surround Sound: The sound disperses evenly, providing an immersive listening experience whether you‚Äôre indoors or outdoors.2. Build and DesignPremium Feel: Despite its affordable price, the build quality feels as premium as the original StormBox.Portability: Compact and lightweight, it‚Äôs perfect for home use, travel, or outdoor adventures.IPX7 Waterproof: Fully waterproof, making it safe for poolside parties or unpredictable weather.3. Battery LifeThe 12-hour battery backup is impressive and more than enough for a full day of listening. It delivers consistent performance without frequent recharging.4. FeaturesTWS Pairing: You can pair two speakers for a true stereo experience.Type-C Charging: Modern and efficient, ensuring quick recharges.LED Lights: Aesthetic and fun, adding a visual flair to your listening sessions.---What Could Be Better?Bass Handling at High Volumes: While the bass is satisfactory at moderate volumes, at maximum levels, the speaker reduces its volume slightly to manage bass output. This ensures clarity but compromises the punchiness some bass lovers might crave.App Support: This model isn‚Äôt supported on the Tribit app, which could limit customization options for advanced users.---Why It‚Äôs Still a WinnerFor ‚Çπ1,599, this speaker delivers incredible value. It‚Äôs a near-perfect blend of clarity, portability, and premium design. While it may not provide the thumping bass of some competitors, it makes up for it with balanced sound and excellent vocal clarity.---Final VerdictPros:Crystal-clear vocals with balanced highs and lows.Compact, lightweight, and highly portable.Sturdy, premium build with waterproofing.Long battery life and modern Type-C charging.Cons:Slight bass adjustment at high volumes.No support on the Tribit app.Rating: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (4.5/5)If you‚Äôre looking for a versatile, budget-friendly speaker with great clarity and decent bass, the Tribit StormBox Mini 12W is an excellent choice. Definitely consider it‚Äîyou won‚Äôt be disappointed!
Build quality ok , sound quality nice but Bass is a bit suppressed for vocals. This is the point. Otherwise all over value for money. Could not auto connect.

reviewTitle: Impressive Sound Quality in a Compact Design!
reviewDescription: I received the Tribit Stormbox Mini today, and I‚Äôm blown away! The sound is incredibly crisp and clear, with impressive stereo audio for such a small speaker. It‚Äôs perfect for taking around the house or on the go. Pairing was seamless, and the build feels sturdy yet lightweight. The audio quality genuinely exceeds expectations at this price point. Do not expect bass but sound feels premium. Highly recommend to anyone looking for great sound in a mini size.For those who are finding sound quality poor, please upgrade to premium subscription of your music app. I use Apple's Lossless audio quality and sounds great.

reviewTitle: Sound quality is great, but the buttons are unresponsive justtwo months in
reviewDescription: Sound is great, clear highs and mids and balanced bass. The only problem is that the whole thing stopped working two months in. The buttons are unresponsive, it's powered on, can't connect to any of my devices. I've tried everything including the hard reset, it just didn't happen. No beep indicating a reset even after a minute of pressing the reset buttons. So, now I have to find a tribit store and hope they fix it.
Nice speaker for daily personal usage... battery backup 3-4 hours with RGB light, bass is just ok, it's not for a bass lover. Voice is clear , RGB light is awesome

reviewTitle: Go for it.. best value for money
reviewDescription: Size of speaker is very Compact.Clarity of sound is awesome you will definitely enjoy the clarity. Connectivity is very fast more than expectation as it is 5.3 Bluetooth, battery life is really good approximately at 100% XBass mode on it take more than 6 hours to exhaust the full battery. Normally battery can last upto 15 hours. Appearance is very fascinating. Very good quality material.

Good overall speakerHigh value for moneyGreat audio throughout, vocals, treble, high bass, low bass. Even at 100% volCharging time kinda slow, 2.5 hours really feels like alot.The sound at first didn't feel loud enough compared to my Mivi Roam 2 which is an excellent value for money speaker by the way. But the difference is fairly noticable when you walk across the room and the surround sound takes the advantage. Also the bass in the Tribit is a huge upgrade that the mivi lacked and also isn't too much like most boat speakers

I must start with saying that I own a range of reowned speakers including tribit x, sound go x sound plus, earfun uboom l etc in list...so I will try to do justice while reviewing it.The sound of this is speaker is different from usual tribit sound signature but does that means it's bad as many are claiming it? Let's find out-The overall tone of sound is thicker than tribit x sound go. It's treble felt recessed due to fabric coating, bass felt less in comparison at 50% volume. Initially I didn't like the sound at all because my ears are accustomed to listening my regular speaker i.e. earfun uboom L .But as I listened it for a longer time my observation changed.Beyond 50% volume It gives a feeling that Sound is coming from a much bigger speaker because of thick vocals and high upper base. The sound at high volumes didn't cause fatigue because recessed treble that turned out to be a blessing in disguise ü•∏. The bass also doesn't felt less, it felt more loud than x sound go (16 watts) despite being only 12 watts.I watched webseries and it gave amazing performance. It has more body in sound and due to side speaker arrangement I was feeling the sound is coming from home theatre not a Bluetooth speaker. It fills the 12√ó14 room with 360 degree sound...at this moment x sound go was sounding tiny in comparison.So to conclude, who have previously listened any of tribit speaker might not feel happy initially. They can skip this speaker if they don't want to hear anything different.Ready to listen something different? then it's a great speaker..I am enjoying it... I have other speaker portronics speaker breeze 5 (25watt) boat stone 350 pro..so not to mention it beats them easily.Give a help vote if this helped you in making a purchase decision as it's the first review of speaker.Collecting speakers is my hobby, I purchase every famous speaker so soon I might be reviewing speakers on YouTube.....Thanks.
Worthy for money

The product is value for money, I have compared with mostly all BT speakers at this range and above‚Ä¶compared with Boat 352 pro, Honeywell Souno, Portronice aound drum p/1, mivi 5 watt speaker.My requirement - Balanced Audio with excellent Mic ( WFH calls)Boat 352 Pro - Audio wise loud but not for longer duration( more than 15-30 mins) ..it hurt your ears(loud sound but signature not the best).Honeywell - worst AudioPotronics sound drum P/1 - sound drum P sounds good but not loud enough and Mic is very bad‚Ä¶Sounddrum 1 - audio ok ok..not the bestMivi 5 watt - very sweet voice ..excellent for 90‚Äôs audio‚Ä¶no bassTribit 34 watt - excellent device - but with cons, treble is very bad‚Ä¶hurt your ear..you can adjust the sound signature, but my preferences was also mic - so Tribit mini - having better mic and loud call quality than 34 watt.An Honest review.

I won't say it's bad but the speaker is for a limited type of userIf you want tribit brand built quality with latest features and great battery life. Go for it.It comes with ambient light and Bluetooth 5.4, which is a great thing, but the sound is concentrated towards the MID range.Forget bass and thump. This speaker is not going to give you that.Pros -‚Ä¢ Great looks with ambient light‚Ä¢ Sturdy built quality‚Ä¢ Battery life and Tribit brand‚Ä¢ Loud clear voice‚Ä¢ 360 surround soundCons -‚Ä¢ No bass effect‚Ä¢ Price should be around 1900

reviewTitle: This Tribit sounds like magic! Took time to adapt to it but once I did I got hooked!
reviewDescription: It's very different from the Tribit sound signature but give it time to grow on you and it keeps growing on you. It's a very well built speaker. Perfect for personal use as that's when you get to experience it's 360 surround magic but it can pack you a punch and fill a regular sized room! It's pricing makes it the best speaker in this range. Remember it's 12 watt and it's really something of a new kind of a bluetooth speaker.the connectivity is great so is the battery life. Won't fit in your pocket but it's easy to carry and it's stylish with the led lights! It's also waterproof. I am giving it 5 stars ü§©
sound not good, extra ports not available, bttery drain easily

I've got the speaker replaced due to a small issue. The speaker that I received initially was making loud popping noise every time before and after playing any media. I think all types of speakers make this noise at a very small level whenever it receives a signal and and while it cuts off. But it was loud in my case. Requested for a replacement and got it in 3 days. The new one seems alright, as I said there is a very small noise which can only be heard if the speaker is placed next to ear.Review:Its small enough to carry around and the sound is loud enough for indoor use. Haven't used it outdoors, so can't comment on that.I've posted a picture with a coffee cup for size reference. Sound clarity is good and the bass seems adequate for its size.Keep in mind that the media app that you are using greatly influences the output of speaker. The free version of YouTube only gives you average audio quality.

I totally love this speaker. I was totally exceeded my expectations and i love the sound quality of this one. Battery life, Connectivity, Quality, Portability and functionality it has all these features and charging ability also is very much appreciated.
